results.title: Our wonderful eyes and their care
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of eyesight. Depicts a boy’s experience in having his eyes examined and in being fitted with glasses. Also gives rules for proper eye care.

results.title: Our wonderful ears and their care
results.brief_description: Using diagrams and an ear model, a doctor explains the structure of the ear, how sounds are heard and how ears should be cared for. No other credits available.

results.title: Our wonderful body: medicines, drugs and poisons
results.brief_description: Offers such safety guidelines as the importance of reading labels, following a doctor’s recommendation and the storage of drugs, medicines and household chemicals away from children. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Our water our future
results.creator_credit: Highland Productions, Victoria. Dept. of Sustainability and Environment, Seven Network Limited (Australia), Katherine McIntosh and Arron Wood
results.brief_description:
This documentary provides an entertaining, informative and educational insight into how Victoria’s homes, farms, environment and industries depend on a secure water supply. It explores the contrasts between rural and urban Victoria, demonstrating that water security is a statewide issue affecting everyone. Hosted by Arron Wood,
Environmental Scientist.

results.title: Our three r's
results.brief_description: A survey of educational services provided in the city of Glasgow. First there is a resume of curriculum and activities in primary schools, then in secondary schools, and finally the opportunities for technical training for day-release students.

results.title: Our street was paved with gold
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Albert Kish
results.brief_description: A filmmaker revisits Montreal’s St. Lawrence Boulevard—the Main—the road from the docks to the heart of immigrant Canada. This is a little Europe, a street of many languages, many Old World foodstuffs, a hundred small courtesies that make the stranger feel at home. For the filmmaker his prevailing memory is of the seventeen steps of a walk-up apartment, but for all Canadians, born or made, this film has many nostalgic links with a common Canadian experience.

results.title: Our story in stamps
results.brief_description: The production of Malayan postage stamps in Britain. Working from a basic design selected in Malaya, British craftsmen prepare and print the perforated sheets of stamps. Intricate printing processes and skilled workmanship go into their creation. Locale sequences in Malaya reveal the relationships between the symbolic designs on the stamps and the landscape, industries and crafts of the country.
results.description: The production of Malayan postage stamps in Britain. Working from a basic design selected in Malaya, British craftsmen prepare and print the perforated sheets of stamps. results.title: Our solar system: the outer planets
results.brief_description: One of a two tape set aimed at children that takes a fun and informative voyage to each planet in our solar system. Interesting facts about each planet are presented, such as size, composition, relative position in the solar system, gravity and temperature. A combination of video footage, photographs and animation are used to present an authentic picture of each planet. ‘The outer planets’ investigates Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and some of their moons including Io, Titan, Miranda and Triton. Pluto, the most outer planet is also visited. See also ‘The Inner planets.’

results.title: Our solar system: the inner planets
results.brief_description: One of a two tape set aimed at children that takes a fun and informative voyage to each planet in our solar system. Interesting facts about each planet are presented, such as size, composition, relative position in the solar system, gravity and temperature. A combination of video footage, photographs and animation are used to present an authentic picture of each planet. ‘The inner planets’ visits Earth, its moon, Venus, Mercury and Mars. See also ‘The Outer planets.’
